structure.unit: MISCELLANEOUS CRIMES AFFECTING BUSINESSES, OCCUPATIONS, AND PROFESSIONS

text.section:
A person is guilty of sports bribery when he:
Offers, confers or agrees to confer any benefit upon a sports participant with intent to influence him not to give his best efforts in a sports contest; or
Offers, confers or agrees to confer any benefit upon a sports official with intent to influence him to perform his duties improperly.
Sports bribery is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 159, effective January 1, 1975.
